Phenomena of relevance to current industrial processes, processes under industrial development or of interest for future commercial applications are particularly welcome. Heterogeneous, homogeneous and biocatalysis are included. Research investigating catalytic actions of heterogeneous, homogeneous, biological and natural systems are especially encouraged. â€¢ Scientifi c aspects of preparation, activation, aging, deactivation, rejuvenation, regeneration and start up transient effects of commercially interesting or representative model catalysts. â€¢ Scientifi c methods of characterization of catalysts, especially if they are applicable to industrial catalysts. â€¢ Chemical engineering aspects relevant to an improved understanding of catalytic phenomena or application to catalysis. Results involving a joint approach by chemical engineering and catalytic science are particularly welcome. â€¢ New catalysts, catalytic reactions, catalytic routes and processes of potential practical interest. â€¢ Catalysis and catalytic processes for sustainable practices, including sustainable energy supply and consumption processes, and sustainable chemicals production. The journal accepts original Research Papers, Reviews, invited Perspective articles and Letters to the Editor. Applied Catalysis B: Environmental will publish papers covering all aspects of environmental catalysis. For information on submission of manuscripts see inside back cover page. Author information Submissions Submission to this journal proceeds totally on-line via the journalâ€™s homepage at http://www. elsevier.com/locate/apcata.
